articles.author: Detroit Free Press, Detroit Free Press
articles.title: Battle of 2 Cities will mean a win for underprivileged kids in Dearborn, Dearborn Heights
articles.description: Two, cities, one goal: Toys for Tots. Agencies collecting new, unwrapped toys for Christmas.

articles.author: Detroit Free Press, Detroit Free Press
articles.title: FBI, police investigate suspicious package found in Dearborn Heights
articles.description: Police are conducting an investigation after discovering an abandoned firearm and documents that created concern for Michigan houses of worship.

articles.author: Associated Press, Ed White, Associated Press
articles.title: Dearborn pays $1.25M in 2016 fatal police shooting
articles.description: A Dearborn officer repeatedly shot Janet Wilson while she was in her car on Michigan Avenue, a busy street, in 2016.

articles.author: Detroit Free Press, Detroit Free Press
articles.title: $20K bonds set for Dearborn couple charged in toddler shooting
articles.description: A Dearborn couple was arraigned today and each received a $20,000 bond on charges relating to the non-fatal shooting of two toddlers at their home.

articles.author: Detroit Free Press, Detroit Free Press
articles.title: Police: 13-year-old Detroit boy in critical condition after being shot in head
articles.description: According to police, the boy's family called the department at 9:15 p.m. to report the incident, which occurred on the 20000 block of Southfield.

articles.author: Detroit Free Press, Hasan Dudar, Detroit Free Press
articles.title: Police looking for suspects in string of Dearborn vehicle larcenies
articles.description: A handgun, wallets, and credit cards were among some of the items stolen during a string of larcenies in Dearborn on the morning of May 9, police say.

articles.author: Detroit Free Press, Aleanna Siacon, Detroit Free Press
articles.title: Suspect in fatal shooting of Dearborn resident now in custody
articles.description: A suspect is now in custody in connection to the fatal shooting of a 37-year-old Dearborn resident on Friday.

articles.author: Detroit Free Press, Robert Allen, Detroit Free Press
articles.title: Shots fired in Dearborn High School parking lot; no injuries reported
articles.description: Two people fight in school hallway during Friday night basketball game; after officials bring them outside, car pulls up, shots fired

articles.author: Detroit Free Press staff
articles.title: Lanes blocked on I-275 after semi hits overpass
articles.description: At semi-truck crash has blocked lanes on northbound I-275 at Cherry Hill Friday morning, the MDOT reported on its Metro Detroit Twitter account.

articles.author: Detroit Free Press staff
articles.title: John O'Reilly re-elected Dearborn mayor, topping councilman Tom Tafelski
articles.description: Dearborn Mayor Jack O'Reilly received 57% of the vote in winning his fourth election to the office.

articles.title: U-M Dearborn chancellor to step down after 18 years on the job

articles.title: Deer cull planned at University of Michigan Dearborn
articles.description: The goal is to reduce the deer population on the university campus to about 20 to 30.

articles.title: 15 deer killed in first two days of cull at U-M Dearborn; hunt resumes Wednesday
articles.description: The goal is to reduce the deer population from about 70 to between 20 and 30.

articles.title: Royal Oak police seek armed man near Beaumont, schools in secure mode
articles.description: Beaumont Hospital in Royal Oak is on alert and several schools were placed in secure mode, as police seek an individual who might be armed.

articles.title: Off-duty Wayne Co. sheriff's deputy fatally shoots intruder in her house
articles.description: The intruder was armed and wearing a black ski mask when he kicked in her door, police said.

articles.title: 5-year-old says teachers taped his mouth shut, threw away his lunch
articles.description: Abdul Dannaoui, 5, said two of his preschool teachers taped his mouth shut and threw his food out.

articles.title: Bad deal in Dearborn: Lawsuits, punches and a car for the mayor

articles.title: 20-year-old man is dead after being shot by Royal Oak officer

articles.title: Florida shooting: How Mich. schools boost security to prevent tragedy

articles.title: Increased cost for sports, concert tickets would mean more money for cops, firefighters

articles.title: Democrats propose changing legal voting age in Michigan to 16
articles.description: A super majority vote in Legislature and  statewide constitutional amendment vote would be needed to change the legal voting age to 16.

articles.title: Notorious Victory Inn in Detroit finally demolished
articles.description: The Victory Inn, a Detroit motel  known for sex trafficking and drugs, was demolished over the weekend.

articles.title: Pileups, canceled flights bring headaches from big storm while schoolkids enjoy the fun

articles.title: Bottle deposits would expand to water, juice containers under bill introduced in Legislature
articles.description: A Michigan lawmaker wants to expand Michigan's 42-year old bottle deposit law to include non-carbonated beverages like water and juice.

articles.title: Michigan: Medical marijuana dispensaries can stay open — for now
articles.description: Existing dispensaries were supposed to shut down by Dec. 15 while they waited to get a license. State rule allows them to stay open.

articles.title: U.S. Rep. John Conyers leaves behind legacy of civil rights, racial justice

articles.title: Michigan's crumbling roads get $300M extra in state budget
articles.description: Of the extra $300M in road funding, about $117M is for state highways, with another $117M going to counties, and $65M going to cities and villages.

articles.author: Detroit Free Press
articles.title: Feedback: Kneeling for the anthem isn't disrespect. Sitting, turning their backs would be
articles.description: The kneeling during the national anthem by NFL players has been labeled as being disrespectful to the flag. But isn't kneeling normally considered to be the ultimate show of respect? Don't we kneel before someone to beg for forgiveness, or to ask for someone'…
